pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:0.5: 12. The training rule on entirely black
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were getting blankets made entirely of black wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.3: People who were walking about the dwellings complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.4: “How can the Sakyan ascetics get blankets made entirely of black wool, just like householder who indulge in sensual pleasures?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.5: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.6: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.7: “How can the monks from the group of six get blankets made entirely of black wool?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.8: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Master. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.12: Foolish men, how can you get blankets made entirely of black wool?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.13: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.14: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.15: ‘If a monk gets a blanket made entirely of black wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.6: there are two kinds of black:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.9: it is made by spreading out, not by weaving.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.11: If he makes the blanket, or gets it made, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.12: When he gets the blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.13: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.14: “And, monks, it should be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.15: To be expanded as in [Relinquishment 1, paragraphs 13–17](pli-tv-bu-vb-np1#13), with appropriate substitutions.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.16: ‘Venerables, this blanket which I got made entirely of black wool is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.17: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.20: ‘I give this blanket back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.21: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.22: If he gets others to finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.23: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.24: If he gets others to finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.25: If he makes one, or gets one made, for someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.26: If he obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.28: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a screen-wall, a mattress, or a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.30: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.31: The second rule, the training rule on entirely black, is finished.
